faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get answers to common questions about our services and the Korean market entry process

q1.question: What makes Web3-Korea Bridge different from other consulting firms?
q1.answer: Our unique combination of 15 years of Samsung Electronics corporate experience, PEF M&A expertise, and deep understanding of both Web3 technology and Korean business culture sets us apart. We provide end-to-end solutions specifically tailored for Web3 companies, not generic consulting services.

q2.question: Which types of Web3 companies do you work with?
q2.answer: We work with a wide range of Web3 companies including DeFi protocols, NFT platforms, blockchain infrastructure providers, crypto exchanges, GameFi projects, and Web3 social platforms. Our experience spans from early-stage startups to established companies looking to expand into Korea.

q3.question: How long does the typical Korean market entry process take?
q3.answer: The timeline varies depending on your specific needs and business model. Typically, our clients see initial market entry within 3-6 months, with full operational establishment taking 6-12 months. We work efficiently while ensuring all legal and regulatory requirements are properly addressed.

q1.question: Do I need to visit Korea during the market entry process?
q1.answer: While not always required, we highly recommend at least one visit to Korea during the process. Face-to-face meetings are highly valued in Korean business culture and can significantly accelerate partnership development. We can arrange all meetings and provide local support during your visit.

q2.question: What level of Korean language support do you provide?
q2.answer: We provide complete Korean language support throughout the entire process. All legal documents, business communications, and negotiations can be conducted in Korean with our team serving as interpreters and cultural bridges. You don't need any Korean language skills to work with us.

q3.question: How do you ensure regulatory compliance for Web3 companies?
q3.answer: We maintain close relationships with Korean regulatory bodies and stay updated on all Web3-related regulations. Our legal partners specialize in blockchain and cryptocurrency regulations, ensuring your business operates within all current and upcoming legal requirements.

q1.question: How is your pricing structured?
q1.answer: Our pricing is customized based on your specific needs and scope of work. We offer both project-based pricing and retainer models. We always provide a detailed proposal with transparent pricing before beginning any work. Initial consultation is complimentary.

q2.question: Do you charge success fees for partnerships you facilitate?
q2.answer: For partnership facilitation, we typically work on a combination of base fees and success-based compensation. This aligns our incentives with your success. The exact structure depends on the scope and complexity of the partnerships involved.

q3.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q3.answer: We accept traditional payment methods including wire transfers and checks. For Web3 companies, we also accept payments in major cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and USDC. Payment terms are typically structured around project milestones.

q1.question: What legal entity structure do you recommend for Web3 companies?
q1.answer: The optimal structure depends on your business model, but we typically recommend establishing a Korean subsidiary (LLC or corporation) for operational activities. For some clients, we may recommend a branch office or representative office structure. We'll analyze your specific situation and recommend the best approach.

q2.question: How do Korean regulations affect Web3 businesses?
q2.answer: Korea has specific regulations for cryptocurrency exchanges, virtual asset service providers, and blockchain businesses. The regulatory environment is evolving, with generally positive government support for blockchain innovation. We help navigate these regulations and ensure full compliance.

q3.question: Do you provide ongoing legal and compliance support?
q3.answer: Yes, we offer ongoing legal and compliance support through our partner law firms. This includes regulatory updates, compliance monitoring, and legal document preparation. Many of our clients retain us for ongoing support after their initial market entry.

faq.title: Common Questions
faq.subtitle: Find quick answers to common questions about contacting Web3 Korea Bridge

q1.question: What is the typical response time for inquiries?
q1.answer: We typically respond to all inquiries within 24 hours during business days (Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM KST). For urgent matters, please indicate so in your message.

q2.question: Do you offer free consultations?
q2.answer: Yes, we offer a complimentary 30-minute initial consultation to understand your needs and discuss how we can help with your Korean market entry.

q3.question: What languages do you support?
q3.answer: We provide full support in English and Korean. Our team can also accommodate Chinese and Japanese for specific requirements.

q4.question: Can we schedule a video call?
q4.answer: Absolutely! After your initial inquiry, we can schedule a video call via Zoom, Google Meet, or your preferred platform to discuss your project in detail.

q5.question: What information should I include in my inquiry?
q5.answer: Please include your company background, target timeline for Korean market entry, specific services you're interested in, and any particular challenges you're facing.
